cn.crowdos.kernel.constraint

Class SpatioPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • cn.crowdos.kernel.constraint.SpatioPolygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Constraint, Decomposable<Constraint>

    public class SpatioPolygon
extends Object
implements Constraint
    A SpatioPolygon class represents a polygon in a two-dimensional space. It implements the Constraint interface.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpatioPolygon(Coordinate... polygon)
      Constructs a SpatioPolygon with the given array of coordinates.

      Constructs a SpatioPolygon with the given list of coordinates.

      Divides a polygon into sub-polygons by dividing its bounding box into a grid of smaller rectangles and testing if each rectangle is inside the polygon.

      • PointInPolygon

        public static boolean PointInPolygon(Coordinate point,
                                     List<Coordinate> polygon)
        Determines if a given point is inside a polygon by counting the number of times a line from the point to the right intersects with the polygon.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to check for inside the polygon.
        polygon - The list of vertices that form the polygon.
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside the polygon, false otherwise.

      • ComputeSubPolygon

        public List<Constraint> ComputeSubPolygon(List<Coordinate> polygon,
                                          int copies)
                                   throws InvalidConstraintException
        Divides a polygon into sub-polygons by dividing its bounding box into a grid of smaller rectangles and testing if each rectangle is inside the polygon.
        Parameters:
        polygon - The polygon to divide into sub-polygons.
        copies - The number of times to divide the bounding box in each direction.
        Returns:
        A list of sub-polygons that cover the area of the original polygon.
        Throws:
        InvalidConstraintException - if a sub-polygon could not be constructed from the given coordinates.
